name: treatment of tallow to esterquat | esterquat | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9769/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of esterquat from tallow. Material and energy inputs are based on literature sources. Transport and infrastructure are based on a large chemical plant. Emissions and water consumption are not included.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of the precoursors tallow, triethanolamine, isopropanol, dimetyhl sulfatem, and nitrogen at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the production of 1 kg of esterquat. The dataset includes material and energy input, production of waste, transports and infrastructure. The dataset doesn't include water consumption and emissions.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2023:Manufacture of soap and detergents, cleaning and polishing preparations, pe

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data based on the European esterquat production
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Quaternary ammonium compounds are obtained by alkylisation of tertiary amines. For esterquat (cationic tensids) at least one ot the alkyl residues must be longer.;For this dataset, representing typical European production mix in the mid 90s, the cationic tensides are produced by esterification of triethanolamines and subsequent quaternation with dimethylsulphate. Isopropanol is used as solvent. Fatty acids used for the esterification step are from tallow.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: data out of ECOSOL study of European Surfactant Industry. Common translation rules used, reported in Chemical report (Althaus et al. 2003).

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Esterquat (tetraakyl ammnioum salts) are one of the most important cationic tensides. The positive electrical charge of the hydrophilic moiety gives the cationic tensides properties that open up applications that are unsuitable or barely suitable for anionic or nonionic tensides. The cationic fabric softeners, for example, attach well to textiles thanks to their affinity for fibres. They give the washed textiles a soft feel and thus improve their wearability. Important applications for these cationic tensides are as microbicides, herbicides, inhibitors of corrosion or of oxidation and so on. In the detergents industry, esterquat is mainly used as intermediate for the production of fabric softeners.
